section.title: Introduction
section.p: Templeton is deep in the middle of development and does not yet have a smooth install procedure. As such, this version of Templeton should only be installed expert developers.

ul.li: ZooKeeper. (Be sure to review and update the ZooKeeper related Templeton configuration as required.)

HCatalog,
To use the ddl resource, HCatalog must be installed in /usr/local/hcat/bin/hcat
To use the hive resource, see instructions below for placing HCatalog into the Hadoop distributed cache.
Pig, see instructions below for placing Pig into the Hadoop distributed cache.

tr.td: Set to the location of your Hadoop install
Set to the location of your HCatalog install
Set to the location of your Tomcat install
Set to the location of the Templeton jar file. After a build the location will be $TEMPLETON_HOME/build/templeton/templeton-0.1.0.jar.

ol.li: Ensure that the required related installations and environment variables are in place.
Review the Templeton configuration and update it as required. In particular ensure that site specific component installation locations are accurate.
Build and install the Templeton war file using ant install-war from $TEMPLETON_HOME. The Tomcat webapps directory must be writable.

Check that your local install works. Assuming that Tomcat is running on port 8080, the following command would give output similar to that shown.
% curl -i http://localhost:8080/templeton/v1/status.json HTTP/1.1 200 OK Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1 Content-Type: application/json Transfer-Encoding: chunked Date: Tue, 18 Oct 2011 19:35:17 GMT
{"status": "ok", "version": "v1"} %

section.title: Authentication
section.p: To run any of the authenticated API calls, sudo must be setup properly.

ol.li: Make sure that you can sudo as yourself. For example, sudo -u $USER date

Create user runner with permission to run the required commands. In the sudoers file:
runner ALL=(%hadoop) NOPASSWD: command1[,command2, ...]
allows runner to run the commands if they are owned by a user in the group hadoop.

section.title: Hadoop Distributed Cache
section.p:
To avoid the installation of Pig and Hive everywhere on the cluster, Templeton gathers a version of Pig or Hive from the
Hadoop distributed cache whenever those resources are invoked. To install the required components in the locations specificed by the default configuration, follow these steps:

ol.li:
Create hive.tar. If you installed HCatalog as noted above, this this is done as follows:
cd /usr/local/hcat tar cf /tmp/hive.tar .

Place hive.tar into the cache.
hadoop fs -put /tmp/hive.tar /user/templeton/hive.tar
Install Pig locally, for example in /usr/local/pig.

Place pig.tar into the cache.
hadoop fs -put /tmp/pig.tar /user/templeton/pig.tar

section.p: The location of these archives (tar files) in the cache, and the location of the installations inside the archives can be specified using the following Templeton configuration variables. (See the Configuration documentation for more information on changing Templeton configuration parameters.)

tr.td: The path to the Pig archive.
The path to the Pig executable.
The path to the Hive archive.
The path to the Hive executable.
